newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonia shares in record trade as maintain gains.
newsitem.headline: Estonia shares in record trade as maintain gains.

text.p: Healthy gains on the Estonian stock market continued on Tuesday when almost all shares rose and the official list reached a record volume.
Total official list trade came to 72 million kroons and the Tallinn stock exchange index climbed by 3.05 percent to 183.37.
"It is a bull market without much analysis," said one dealer, expressing scepticism over the gains.
Hansapank had the highest turnover at 23.5 million kroons and closed four kroons higher at 171 kroons.
Union Bank, yesterday's leader after it announced a merger with North Estonia Bank, lost some of its shine.
It registered trade of 20.7 million kroons but closed at 45.20 kroons, down 3.30 kroons. Savings Bank turnover was 10.4 million kroons and it finished five kroons higher at 81.50.
Some 7.9 million kroons of Forekspank shares changed hands and it closed up a strong 8.2 kroons at 135 kroons. It earlier announced that its 1996 profit was 46.5 million kroons.
Tallinna pank also made strong gains to close 7.75 kroons up at 67.50 kroons after turning over 5.8 millions kroons.
Over-the-counter-market trade was dominated by Rakvere meat plant which turned over 8.6 million kroons to close at 14.15 kroons, down 0.6 kroons.
